allTasksData.title: MLSum
allTasksData.motivation: Large-scale multilingual dataset for evaluating abstractive summarization

allTasksData.title: XSum
allTasksData.motivation: Large scale monolingual dataset for evaluating extreme summarization.

allTasksData.title: WikiLingua
allTasksData.motivation: Large-scale multilingual dataset for evaluating cross-lingual abstractive summarization

allTasksData.title: WebNLG
allTasksData.motivation: The WebNLG dataset is a large bi-lingual dataset with crowdsourced reference texts and a rather large variety of knowledge in the inputs. A web-based evaluation platform is already existing.

allTasksData.title: CommonGen
allTasksData.motivation: A medium sized corpus with a unique reasoning challenge and interesting evaluation possibilities.

allTasksData.title: E2E
allTasksData.motivation: One of the largest limited-domain NLG datasets and is frequently used as a data-to-text generation benchmark.

allTasksData.title: DART
allTasksData.motivation: Hierarchical, structured format with its open-domain nature

allTasksData.title: Czech Restaurant
allTasksData.motivation: One of a few non-English data-to-text datasets in a well-known domain, covering a morphologically rich language.

allTasksData.title: ToTTo
allTasksData.motivation: Controlled Table2Text task with non-divergent, annotator-revised text outputs

allTasksData.title: Wiki-Auto
allTasksData.motivation: Wiki-Auto is the largest open text simplification dataset currently available. For GEM, Wiki-Auto acts as the training set.

allTasksData.title: TURKCorpus
allTasksData.motivation: TURKCorpus is a high-quality simplification dataset where each source sentence is associated with 8 human-written simplifications.

allTasksData.title: ASSET
allTasksData.motivation: ASSET is a high quality simplification dataset where each source (not simple) sentence is associated with 10 human-written simplifications.
